comment: If you need to take this to complete the credit take this course. You have weekly quizzes, and discussion posts. They are super easy to do and the exams are straight from the material. The professor sends weekly email reminders so there is no way to miss anything.

Gives weekly discussions about the subject of the week. Honestly wouldn't say opting into Cengage is necessary since power points and pdf of the chapters are uploaded onto D2l. Quizzes are 2 tries and the exams are based off the study guides. Gives extra credit and final assignment is to attend an art event and write 2 paragraph essay.
Super easy, minimal work. 2 attempts on quizzes, 1 attempt on tests. All the answers are in his PowerPoints.

Take this professor!! This was by far the easiest class I have taken, literally the only thing I had to worry about were the tests (which is also easy)!! His in class assignments were also not very difficult as long as you turn it in on time, this course overall is an easy A if you want the credit!!

Easy course and easy to manage. Discussion posts, quarterly assignments, and weekly quizzes. Everything is due on the next Sunday. Quizzes are short and easy to study for. Gives study guides that mirror tests. Late work has deduction of ten pts per day. Become familiar w/ syllabus and policies.Very fair grader. PPTs are very helpful, no lectures.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! Easy A! I took him online and got 100s on all the assignments. There is a discussion every week (which are VERY easy) and a quiz that is 5 questions but its easy 100 and you can retake the quiz twice. You do have to go to an art related thing and write an essay about it, which is just two paragraphs in this class
He talks very low, but besides that the class is an easy A.

Easy class, I stopped going after a month because he made everything accessible online. He would just read off the power points and was very monotone, not to mention he talked really low and it was hard to hear him. But, assignments, tests, and "essays" were all really easy. Take this class if you want something easy.
Professor Patterson is a really sweet guy. He talks fairly low, but he brings a microphone at times. All presentations are on d2l. Discussion posts are very easy and so are the tests.

Prof. Adreon Patterson was a polite and well organized instructor. He typically has one assignment per week, which is very easy and his test are just as easy. Unless you're an art major or simply have an interest for art, the class won't be that interesting. He's very polite, understanding, and I would highly recommend taking him if needed.

He talks very softly so that can be difficult, but he often time brings a microphone.The work is very easy and so are the tests as long as you look over the study guide. I would definitely take this class for a easy A.There is no HW because we do a group assignment like once a week in class. He is very nice and responds to emails quickly.

I took this course last semester in 2021. Very easy class, easy A. The tests are easy and there's only a few of them. Very nice professor and yes he can put the class to sleep with his voice and lectures. He mainly goes through the power points in class and sometimes you'll watch a movie. Would recommend.

Patterson is understanding and nice but the lectures are a bit monotonous. There's not a whole lot of class engagement and it's just powerpoints. the projects weren't difficult and there weren't a lot of them. He does count attendance but it doesn't actively make a difference in your grade in the end. Would recommend if you need an easy A.

So. many. Lectures. This guy can put a class to sleep. He sometimes drones for a while but he's a nice man. He doesn't really crack jokes or anything and theres only three "major" assignments. The only reason I got a C was because I literally didn't turn in three assignments. You'll be fine as long as you turn in SOMETHING.

Not many grades and the assignments aren't difficult at all. Lots of lecturing and watching videos. The test is almost identical to the study guides that he posts the answers to, so all you have to do is review the material. He does take attendance. It's a good class to sign up for especially if you need to fulfill a general education requirement.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Patterson is a sweet person. Its definitely an easy class. The tests are exactly like the study guides. I would definitely sign up for this class if its for a general education course.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: He knows that this class is one you take to tick off a box and he makes sure that he doesn't add any more stress to your life. He was a really nice guy and his class felt so calm. He still expects you to show up but you don't need the book and there are some pretty interesting documentaries. Take him if you don't mind showing up and want an A.

attendance heavy don't bother buying textbook 4 assignments and 3 tests lectures and videos gives study guide that is identical to test very nice and understanding guy loved him, very boring lectures and materials but easy credit

He is super nice and very lenient if you need an extension! Attendance is mandatory but all tests are online, no lockdown. Once a month there is an in class assignment but he will let you know when it is, very easy A. Take if you are looking for a no stress class.

Super easy A. Attendance affects your grade but you don't have to listen when you go. Study guide key is just the answers to the test. Def recommend if you just want to fill a requirement. Have to try to fail this class. If you miss a test he will reopen it if needed. Took the tests at home. 3 assignments and one paper at the end of the semester.

This class is an easy A, but don't take it if you want to learn about art. He lectures by reading his Powerpoints, but the study guide is the test (he gives a study guide answer key). Attendance affects your grade after 3 absences, but you don't learn anything if you show up. He says buy the textbook but don't, because you NEVER use it.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I had him for art and you have to TRY to fail its a simple class, tests are straight from the study guide. He seems like a cool guy but hes very quiet, during his lectures he uses a mic but whispers it sounds like ASMR. He passes around an attendance sheet so you do have to be there, I just did homework from other classes in there.
Super easy online class. He's very understanding and easy to reach if you need anything. Every test we took had a "study guide" that he'd post... it was just the answer key to the test.
It's harder to fail this class than pass it. However, don't buy a textbook as the quizzes and tests are based on lectures given to you, don't make the same mistake I did.

Not hard in the slightest, literally, discussions were just asking you to state your opinions on the current topic, the essays were 2 paragraphs. Never really interacted with the professor so if you like connecting with people, not the class to go with. Definitely easy to get a hold of though, sent weekly update emails to say what was due.

Personally, i think for everything going on in the world, he was the most understanding of it. He was not a difficult online teacher whats so ever. Gave study guide keys that are like the tests. If you want to add on an extra class or need to take this class, I would recommend him. You would literally have to try to fail to not get a 100 overall

All of the tests and quizzes are given to you word for word on power points except that he makes mistakes on how he sets the quizzes so I have had to email him a ton about it. He does not teach but if you are just fulfilling the credit it's a great class to take. His assignments are extremely vague and make no sense. He does offers extra credit.

If you are looking for an easy art teacher he's the one to go to. he doesnt seem very engaged in what we are learning but unless you are doing something in life that requires this kind of art knowledge, theres no reason to not pick him. tests and quizzes are all from book and study guides

You show up to class, he reads off a PowerPoint, you go home. Sometimes hell show you YouTube videos in class that are vaguely relevant to the material. He says read the book, but you dont need it. He doesnt interact with students and doesnt try to engage us. The tests and the study guides are nearly identical. Just show up most days and listen
